page.title: 09CARNIVAL
page.content: On the Saturday after 14th September, in memory of King Alfred, Pewsey Carnival takes place. After a week of fairs, races and other celebrations a grand procession takes place on the Saturday evening. Local transport firms loan lorries and groups of people put on fancy dress to portray scenes of historical or topical interest. The whole procession drives around the town, which takes at least an hour, making collections for charity. 80% of local people watch and many visitors come from Devizes, Marlborough and the villages in between.
